Select Medical is one of the largest operators of critical illness recovery hospitals, rehabilitation hospitals, outpatient rehabilitation centers, and occupational health centers in the United States, with more than 50,000 colleagues caring for nearly 80,000 patients every day across our care continuum.
The Software Development Lead will review, analyze, develop, and modify enterprise application systems and web sites. The responsibilities will include devising software development architectures, leading and mentoring more junior developers, coding, performing peer code reviews, testing, debugging, and documenting programs for new or existing systems, working directly with the business users.
Responsibilities:

The Software Development Lead will be challenged with developing custom software solutions or web sites that meet the needs of Select Medical's dynamic environment. The Software Development Lead will be responsible for providing accurate and timely completion of technical development and support tasks in accordance with Information Systems standards and methodologies. The candidate will also need to help improve the company’s software development processes and provide technical mentoring to more junior developers. An ability to rapidly learn new coding languages and environments and ensuring a superior level of customer service is a must. The ideal candidate will also need to be comfortable working in a fast-paced, quickly evolving environment and learning the healthcare business. The position will be based in Mechanicsburg, PA.

6+ years of C# (or VB.NET) and ASP.NET web development experience
ASP.NET, .NET framework, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, JQuery, MVC, WebForms
IIS server configuration
Relational Database Design and Development (SQL Server and/or Oracle)
Experience with source control systems, preferably GIT
Ability to develop web sites that work on multiple versions of Internet Explorer, Google Chrome, Firefox, and Safari and support mobile devices
Prior experience designing scalable enterprise software solutions
Strong interpersonal and communication skills a must
Strong dedication to quality customer service
Strong multi-tasking skills essential
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Interest in learning the healthcare business
Willingness to learn new technologies
Must possess a personal sense of urgency
Superior teamwork skills
BS or BA degree in Business Systems or Computer Science
Desirable Qualifications:

Transact-SQL, PL-SQL, XML, XSL, Telerik Controls, ASP, XML, XSL, HTML5, CSS3
Experience in using SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, or any other Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence tool
Prior Healthcare experience
Experience working with UI graphic designers

Summary
The MIL Corporation seeks a Senior Software Engineering Analyst to support a Federal Government client at our Charleston, South Carolina location. As a member of the team, the successful candidate will support the operation of both domestic and overseas financial systems, including payroll, accounting, accounts receivable, disbursing, cash reconciliation, data warehouse, imaging, and Treasury reporting systems.

Responsibilities

Plan, develop, integrate and automate application and operating system tasks through an automated batch scheduler with focus on efficiency and automation
Develop, document, and execute daily, bi-weekly, monthly, and annual operating procedures to support the production financial systems
Perform the installation of application software and core database software upgrades, patches, and hotfixes
Analyze and correct both functional and technical issues that arise as a result of executing daily, bi-weekly, monthly, and annual operating procedures
Plan, test, and execute continuity of operations plans for all applicable systems
Must place emphasis on teamwork and work well in a team-oriented environment
Plan, organize and manage the configuration, install, optimize, administer, and maintain financial systems supported by the Unit
Provide efficient analysis and troubleshooting of production issues, both during and after normal business hours, to ensure service level agreements (SLAs) and metrics are maintained or exceeded

Required Qualifications

Minimum of 5 years of technical experience in systems development, requirements development, and/or automated financial systems analysis
Must have the ability to effectively communicate technical as well as non-technical information, both orally and in writing
Per federal guidelines, you may be required to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or willingness to obtain vaccination

Desired Qualifications

Experience working with financial management systems
Four-year degree in computer science, business, or closely related field
Experience with BMC Control-M
Experience with PeopleTools based PeopleSoft Human Resources Management System (HRMS)

Education

BA/BS desired in computer science, business, or closely related field desired.

Clearance

All applicants for this position must be able to obtain a Secret Clearance issued by DoS; please note that the clearance process takes into account both criminal and financial background aspects.

jobTitle: Associate Principal, Software Engineering: Software Development Test (SDET)
jobDetails:
Who We Are
The Options Clearing Corporation (OCC) is the world's largest equity derivatives clearing organization. Founded in 1973, OCC is dedicated to promoting stability and market integrity by delivering clearing and settlement services for options, futures and securities lending transactions. As a Systemically Important Financial Market Utility (SIFMU), OCC operates under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System. OCC has more than 100 clearing members and provides central counterparty (CCP) clearing and settlement services to 19 exchanges and trading platforms. More information about OCC is available at www.theocc.com.
What We Offer
A highly collaborative and supportive environment developed to encourage work-life balance and employee wellness. Some of these components include:
A hybrid work environment, up to 2 days per week of remote work
Tuition Reimbursement to support your continued education
Student Loan Repayment Assistance
Technology Stipend allowing you to use the device of your choice to connect to our network while working remotely
Generous PTO and Parental leave
Competitive health benefits including medical, dental and vision.
What You'll Do
You will be part of the Integration team, comprising of Diverse group of automation, Devops, Functional/Nonfunctional engineers responsible for integrating and validating large cloud-based data systems that will serve as the backbone for promoting any releases into the production instances.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each primary duty satisfactorily.
Works in an Agile team throughout the Lifecycle to collaborate on the analysis, design, development & testing.
Actively participates in Sprint planning sessions to create stories with robust acceptance criteria while helping identify missing or incomplete requirements.
Actively participate in all testing phases within the sprint from test planning, test execution, defect management and sprint closure.
Actively participates in design/technical reviews to identify missing, incomplete or inaccurate design assumptions or design choices with product teams.
You will help us take on unique technical challenges associated with testing large datasets with various functional teams on both public cloud and hybrid environments.
Strong aptitude to learn about new technologies and how they apply to OCC’s Business and Architecture Frameworks.
Develop and leverage automation tools to provide a quicker time to market for delivery of project solutions.
Participate in analysis of the issues/defect closures by working closely with RIT Automation/functional engineers along with respective product teams.
The ability to take ownership of multiple significant projects/efforts.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Supervisory Responsibilities:
None
Qualifications:
The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary functions.
5+ years of Quality Assurance, Quality Engineering experience.
3+ years of software development or equivalent automation experience using Python, Java or other programming language.
3+ years of experience working with relational db.
3+ years of experience working as a member of an Agile development team.
Thorough working knowledge of SQL
Familiarity with DevOps tools and technologies such as GIT, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Nexus/Artifactory and CI/CD pipeline.
Experience working with Cloud ecosystems such as AWS.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills, sound judgement and time management skills.
Technical Skills:
Experience in the basic understanding of the pseudo code.
Experience in rigorous data analysis (highly analytical)
Experience with Devops/CICD tools.
Experience with basic scripting in (Python, Unix).
 Trading and derivative industry experience preferred.
 Experience with Database SQL queries, as well as tools like Microsoft Excel.
 Basic Quant knowledge is a plus.
Education and/or Experience:
BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field or equivalent experience
Certificates or Licenses:
AWS Certification is a plus

DescriptionVoltServer is seeking an Electrical Engineer with a Firmware Focus to join our growing product development team. We are seeking an individual who can architect, design and implement quality embedded firmware code for our Digital Electricity products. Your exact background isn’t critical, but you will need to have solid experience developing code for embedded systems and an understanding of power electronics to be successful in this role. The individual we are seeking should be creative with an aptitude to learn new things and an excellent team player.ResponsibilitiesDesign and develop production-quality C code for Product DevelopmentDevise, document, and run test cases to debug and test code, including unit testsComplete code reviews, both as reviewer and as revieweeUse tools—such as static analysis—as well as develop/discover new ones to improve quality and efficiencyWork with test team to develop validation planDocument design and usage, as well as change log / release notesBrainstorm improvements to architecture and development processProvide support for team in troubleshooting issues in the field and in developmentCompetenciesThe ideal candidate will have:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in EE, CE or equivalent5+ years of experience with firmware developmentCircuit analysis/debugging experienceUnderstanding of software libraries, firmware modules, static analysis and unit testingExperience with communications protocols such as CAN, SPI, I2C, etcExperience with C is preferredExperience with python, C#, and any other languages is a plusExperience with bootloadersExperience with source control management, particularly gitExperience with standard electronics lab equipment such as multi-meters, oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, temperature chambers, load banks, etcExperience managing small or large projects in an electronics development environmentAbility to read and interpret schematics and basic circuit troubleshootingAbility to coordinate work with other team members for successful project executionAbility to Work independently, manage your own time and prioritiesExcellent communications skillsKnowledge or experience working with control systems and implanting control systems on microcontrollers is a plusOther engineering skills such as soldering, populating circuit boards, etc. are a plusAbout UsVoltServer is an innovative company and the first to pioneer Digital Electricity.
